snippet: Hundreds of mayoral contests in Venezuela on Sunday are seen as an early test of President Nicolás Maduro and his ability to carry the country further along a socialist path.
abstract: Venezuelans head to polls to elect hundreds of mayors around country; results, viewed as early test of Pres Nicolas Maduro's ability to carry country further along socialist path laid out by predecessor and mentor Hugo Chavez, do not show a major shift in the country's political alignment.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of mayoral contests in Venezuela on Sunday are seen as an early test of President Nicolás Maduro and his ability to carry the country further along a socialist path.

headline.main: Venezuelan Mayoral Votes Show No Big Power Shift
headline.print_headline: Venezuelan Mayoral Votes Show No Big Power Shift
